headline: Netflix Stock Drops 6.5% This Week Amid Warner Bros Acquisition Battle and AI Concerns
summary: Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) closed the week at $76.87, down 6.48% from February 6. That’s five times worse than the broader market’s 1.29% decline and leaves the streaming giant down 18% year to date. The stock trades near its 52-week low of $79, a sharp reversal from 2024’s momentum. Three storylines explain what’s happening. Analysts Maintain Buy ... Netflix Stock Drops 6.5% This Week Amid Warner Bros Acquisition Battle and AI Concerns

headline: Netflix Faces High Stakes Battle For Warner Bros And Future Growth
summary: Netflix (NasdaqGS:NFLX) is pursuing an acquisition of Warner Bros. Discovery that has triggered an escalating bidding contest. Activist investor Ancora Holdings is urging shareholders to oppose the Netflix deal and support a rival, higher offer from Paramount Skydance. Regulators at the U.S. Department of Justice and in Europe are reviewing the transaction for potential antitrust concerns, adding execution risk. The situation is moving toward a proxy contest and a high stakes shareholder...

headline: Universities Feel a Fiscal Squeeze Despite Solid Performance
summary: Rising costs and Trump pressure on higher education boosted endowment spending. Fortunately, returns on stocks provided a cushion.
